items.title: Chip Roy Threatens to ‘Blow Crap Up’ if Biden Defies Congress on the Debt Ceiling
items.text: Representative Chip Roy does not believe that President Biden will use the 14th Amendment to avoid a debt ceiling standoff with House Republicans. He warned that if Biden did, Republicans would "blow crap up." #politics

items.title: First it was your gas stove, now it’s your dishwashing appliance
items.text: The Department of Energy's proposed energy efficiency standards for dishwashers are "unconstitutional" and "asinine", according to a recent op-ed. The author argues that Congress alone has the authority to make laws, and claims that efficiency rules can actually lead to higher water usage and household costs. #politics

items.title: US ambassador accuses South Africa of arming Russians
items.text: US ambassador to South Africa accuses country of providing weapons to Russia for its war in Ukraine via a sanctioned cargo ship that docked secretly at a naval base near Cape Town. #foreignaffairs

items.title: Washington defense leaders urge Senate to pass military budget: China 'is not waiting'
items.text: Defense leaders warn Congress that defaulting on the military budget would harm U.S. global standing and embolden China, jeopardizing soldier pay and defense strategy. #foreignaffairs

items.title: Rep. Dunn Wants Alabama Shipbuilder Investigated Over Alleged Ties to China
items.text: Rep. Neal Dunn (R-Fla.) calls for an investigation into Austal USA, a U.S. Navy vendor with alleged ties to a Chinese shipbuilder, and questions whether the company weakens U.S. Navy and Coast Guard from within. #foreignaffairs

items.title: Big Three Ignore Explosive Hearing Exposing Dangers of Woke ESG
items.text: Three state officials criticized the dangers of ESG on Americans’ retirement funds in May. However, ABC, CBS, and NBC ignored the hearing, possibly due to leftist bias or their pro-ESG investors. #economy

items.title: Florida 13-year-old with criminal history allegedly shoots police officer in foot
items.text: A 13-year-old with a criminal record shot a Florida police officer in the foot during a chase, leading to a gun battle and the boy being shot several times by officers. #criminal

items.title: California reparations committee calls for ending cash bail, no longer prosecuting low-level crimes
items.text: California's reparations task force recommends ending cash bail and prosecution of low-level crimes due to racial disparities in pretrial detention outcomes. #criminal

items.title: Pennsylvania man accused of sexually abusing 4 children: police
items.text: Pennsylvania man John Stevens has been arrested for sexually abusing four children between the ages of 5 and 8 years old. #crime

items.title: 49ers' Kyle Shanahan: Wife won't travel to Philadelphia for NFC Championship rematch because of Eagles fans
items.text: San Francisco 49ers head coach Kyle Shanahan revealed his wife won't attend the NFC Championship game rematch against the Philadelphia Eagles due to her previous bad experience with the fan base. #sports

items.title: Airheads candy challenge goes viral as TikTok users discover they've been eating it 'incorrectly'
items.text: A new viral food trend on TikTok involves shaking Airheads candy to change its shape and flavor. The hack has been passed down by fans for over three decades and has now gone mainstream. #AirheadsChallenge

items.title: LIV Golf's Phil Mickelson rips USGA CEO Mike Whan, alleges collusion with PGA Tour
items.text: Phil Mickelson criticized the US Golf Association's change of criteria to participate in the US Open on social media, claiming collusion with the PGA Tour. Mickelson called out CEO Mike Whan and the USGA, stating that the changes in the criteria were a "d--- move" and a "direct attack" on Talor Gooch's career, who will now have to finish well at the PGA Championship or qualify through the qualifiers. #golf

items.title: Tampa Bay radio host calls out New York broadcaster who said Rays' historic start is 'suspicious'
items.text: Radio host questions Tampa Bay Rays' historic start in MLB. Without evidence, he insinuates cheating, but local host defends hometown team. #sports

items.title: Kentucky Derby Winner Mage Is on Track to Run in the Preakness, Pursue Triple Crown
items.text: Kentucky Derby winner Mage is on track to run in the Preakness Stakes next week as part of an attempt to win horse racing's first Triple Crown since 2018. #sports

summary: John Stevens arrested for sexually abusing kids. Coach's wife won't attend game due to past Philly fan trauma. Tens of thousands of migrants seek asylum. US ambassador accuses South Africa of aiding Russia. Teen shoots Florida cop during chase. Default on military budget harms US global standing. California reparations task force recommends ending cash bail. Ryan accuses gov't of 'whipping' Haitian migrants. Airheads candy trend goes viral. Phil Mickelson criticizes US Golf Association. Supreme Court ruling makes it easier for illegal alien to seek asylum. Rep. warns against using 14th Amendment. Rep. calls for investigation into US Navy vendor. ESG dangers on retirement funds criticized. Proposed dishwasher efficiency standards called 'unconstitutional.'
